prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Maya Fey
Description: My assistant and a disciple in the Kurain Tradition of spirit channeling.
Character 1
Name: Mia Fey
Description: Maya's older sister and my eternal mentor in life and law. Passed away 2 years ago.
Character 2
Name: Godot
Description: A prosecutor who is shrouded in mystery. He seems to know me somehow.
Character 3
Name: Dick Gumshoe
Description: Homicide detective at the local precinct. In charge of the initial investigation.
Character 4
Name: Maggey Byrde
Description: A waitress at Tres Bien. Was found guilty of murder thanks to the phony me.
Character 5
Name: Jean Armstrong
Description: Tres Bien's owner and chef. A witness in the case who is also into aromatherapy.
Character 6
Name: Glen Elg
Description: The victim. Was a programmer. Maggey had apparently never even seen him before.
Character 7
Name: Victor Kudo
Description: Was in Tres Bien at the time of the incident. Has a thing for waitresses.
Character 8
Name: Lisa Basil
Description: The CEO of Blue Screens, Inc., and Glen Elg's boss. Absolutely not a robot.
Character 9
Name: Violetta → Viola Cadaverini
Description: Possibly part of the staff at Tender Lender? A thoroughly bitter person.
Character 10
Name: Furio Tigre
Description: The head of Tender Lender loan company. Also known as "The Tiger".
Character 11
Name: Bruto Cadaverini
Description: The head of the Cadaverini Family crime syndicate. Seems to live for his granddaughter.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: It's my all-important badge. It shows that I am a defense attorney.
Evidence 1
Name: Maya's Magatama
Description: A present from Maya. It reacts to people who have secrets in their hearts. On loan from Maya. Recovered in the kitchen of Tres Bien.
Evidence 2
Name: Magazine Clipping
Description: An article from December 5th. Says I was trounced and my client was found guilty.
Evidence 3
Name: Sports Paper
Description: Dates from December 3rd, the day of the incident. On it is a doodle that said 'MC Bomber' with an arrow pointing to '100,000' that was crossed out. 'Ahahahaha' and a laughing face are written next to it. Left by a costumer in Tres Bien on Dec. 3rd. Left by the victim. Doodle is in victim's handwriting.
Evidence 4
Name: Job Listings
Description: Picked up from a bench in Vitamin Square. Thrown away by the old man.
Evidence 5
Name: Lunch Special
Description: Tres Bien lunch special. Costs 20 dollars despite how unbelievably bad it tastes.
Evidence 6
Name: Small Bottle
Description: Found in the kitchen. Shape is different from the others bottles. Contents unknown. The victim's ear medicine. Found covered in unidentified fingerprints in the kitchen. The victim's ear medicine. Covered in Furio Tigre's fingerprints.
Evidence 7
Name: Scooter
Description: Ridden by my phony. The wheel guard is all smashed up.
Evidence 8
Name: Jean's Loan Contract
Description: Jean's debt is half a million dollars. The owner of the loan is Tender Lender.
Evidence 9
Name: Victor's Note
Description: "Convicted before, a wicked man or woman, repeat offender -- Victor Kudo"
Evidence 10
Name: Glen's Autopsy Report
Description: Died of potassium cyanide poisoning. Time of death was between 1:30 and 2:30 PM.
Evidence 11
Name: Tres Bien Floor Plans
Description: Blueprints of the crime scene. [caption] The view from the entrance is obstructed and could only see the patio.
Evidence 12
Name: Crime Photo
Description: A photo of the scene taken from near the kitchen. [caption] Two dining tables are separated by a folding screen. The one closer to the camera is empty. The other one is where the victim collapse on the table. There is an intact vase on each table. A coffee cup is knocked over and the the table cloth is stained by coffee. Near the coffee table are some pieces of papers. No one is sitting across from the victim.
Evidence 13
Name: Coffee Cup
Description: The coffee contained potassium cyanide. Covered in the victim and Maggey's fingerprints.
Evidence 14
Name: Victim's Lottery Ticket
Description: A winning ticket for half a million dollars. Found during a body search of Maggey.
Evidence 15
Name: Apron
Description: Worn by Maggey at the time of the incident. Has small pockets but big stains.
Evidence 16
Name: Potassium Cyanide
Description: A deadly powdery poison. Bears Maggey's fingerprints. Found in her apron pocket.
Evidence 17
Name: Victim's Prescription Bag
Description: The victim got this from the doctor before going to Tres Bien. The bag is empty.
Evidence 18
Name: Victor's Testimony
Description: "When the incident occurred, I broke the vase at my seat. I'm sorry."
Evidence 19
Name: Millionaire Radio Flyer
Description: Experience the most thrilling ten minutes of your life every Monday at 1:30 PM!
Evidence 20
Name: Glen's Calendar
Description: On Dec. 3rd, the day of the incident, there is a note saying, "Meet with The Tiger".
Evidence 21
Name: Losing Horse Racing Tickets
Description: Horse racing betting tickets. Found in Glen Elg's desk. There's over 500 of them!
Evidence 22
Name: Gumshoe's Lunchbox
Description: A tenderly handmade lunchbox. Fills the stomach with love and plenty of weenies.
Evidence 23
Name: MC Bomber
Description: Found at Tender Lender. A sample disc with the name written in marker. Found at Tender Lender. Contains a computer virus program. A computer virus made by Glen Elg. Potentially worth million of dollars.
Evidence 24
Name: Tres Bien Matches
Description: Matches used for advertising. Found lying in Tender Lender.
Evidence 25
Name: Repair Bill
Description: A car repair bill for $15,000. Paid by Tigre to the Cadaverini Family.
Evidence 26
Name: Paper Badge
Description: Found at Tender Lender. Made of cardboard and painted to look authentic.
Evidence 27
Name: Viola's Medical Papers
Description: A 1 million dollar bill for cranial surgery. Payment was due last year.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: La mirror, it was in z'e middle of la restaurant, dividing z'e two 'alves.
Person: Armstrong
Testimony 1
Testimony: Z'ere is only one seat from which you could 'ave seen an image of la victim.
Person: Armstrong
Testimony 2
Testimony: Z'at was la seat at z'e table next to la victim's. Z'at was where la old man was sitting.
Person: Armstrong
Testimony 3
Testimony: After la terrible incident occurred, I move la mirror so it was not in z'e way.
Person: Armstrong
Testimony 4
Testimony: But naturally, I did not touch anything else!
Person: Armstrong

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else. Let's think step by step:
response:
To identify the contradiction between the evidence and testimony, we can analyze the statements from Jean Armstrong, who provided several testimonies regarding the position of the mirror and initial scene observations at Tres Bien.

Looking at Testimony 0, Armstrong mentions, "La mirror, it was in z'e middle of la restaurant, dividing z'e two 'alves." Testimony 3 states that after the incident, Armstrong moved the mirror “so it was not in z’e way.” 

This implies that the mirror was indeed obstructing the view during the event, suggesting that anyone sitting farther from the victim wouldn't have seen what happened. However, if the mirror was in the middle dividing the two halves, then after it was moved, this would inherently suggest a change in visibility for those present, including the possibility of visibility to the victim from different angles or tables.

Now, looking at Evidence 11, which provides the "Tres Bien Floor Plans," we see that the layout includes detailed obstructions. The test results indicate that visibility of the victim's location was obstructed, which supports Armstrong's testimony about the mirror being in the middle.

However, moving the mirror and acknowledging the obstruction in the view creates a contradiction about the ability of a person to see or not see the incident as it occurred. By moving the mirror, Armstrong implies the previous position was obstructing, but she attempts to assert that her moving it didn't disturb any other evidence, which is not particularly clear or consistent.

Based on this, we can pair the relevant evidence and testimony that contradicts each other, particularly focusing on the conflict regarding visibility of the victim caused by the mirror's placement and the act of moving it:

{"evidence": 11, "testimony": 3}

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: La victim, Monsieur Elg, 'e came to my restaurant alone.
Person: Armstrong
Testimony 1
Testimony: I remember la old man arrived not long after 'im.
Person: Armstrong
Testimony 2
Testimony: I remember la old man arrived not long after 'im, just after 2 PM.
Person: Armstrong
Testimony 3
Testimony: Z'ere were no other customers.
Person: Armstrong
Testimony 4
Testimony: When 'e got word 'e won la lottery, Mon. Elg became very excited.
Person: Armstrong
Testimony 5
Testimony: It was approximately 5 minutes later z'at la poisoning incident occurred.
Person: Armstrong
Testimony 6
Testimony: Non, z'ere was no time for a phony to do la acting.
Person: Armstrong

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else. Let's think step by step:
response:
To identify a contradicting pair of evidence and testimony, we need to look for situations where the timing or details presented by the testimony conflict with the evidence provided.

In this case, we have the following relevant evidence:
- Evidence 10 (Glen's Autopsy Report) states that Glen Elg died of potassium cyanide poisoning between 1:30 PM and 2:30 PM.
- Evidence 13 (Coffee Cup) states that the coffee contained potassium cyanide and has fingerprints from the victim and Maggey.

From the testimonies:
- Testimony 5 from Jean Armstrong states that the poisoning incident occurred approximately 5 minutes after Glen Elg won the lottery, which he did at the restaurant when he became very excited (mentioned in Testimony 4). If the poisoning happened approximately 5 minutes after he became excited about winning the lottery, and if we assume the lottery win happened around the time he arrived (as per Armstrong's other testimonies), this would suggest that the poisoning occurred quite early, potentially around 1:35 PM, which is within the range of the time of death reported (1:30 PM to 2:30 PM).

However, Armstrong's testimony places the incident at just after 2 PM (Testimony 2), which contradicts the timeline provided by the autopsy report because it states he died between 1:30 PM and 2:30 PM.

Thus, the evidence regarding Glen’s time of death contradicts the testimony about the timing of the poisoning incident described by Jean Armstrong. 

Based on this analysis, the perfect pair of contradicting evidence and testimony is:

{"evidence": 10, "testimony": 2}

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: I don't know nothin' about no murder.
Person: Tigre
Testimony 1
Testimony: I was tied up with business in December last year. Spent all'a my time in my office.
Person: Tigre
Testimony 2
Testimony: The day youse talkin' about, I was in de office, too. I never saw that kid before.
Person: Tigre
Testimony 3
Testimony: I got whales lined up to borrow cash from Tender Lender every single day.
Person: Tigre
Testimony 4
Testimony: Youse wanna check my alibi, just ask Violetta.
Person: Tigre

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else. Let's think step by step:
response:
To determine which evidence and testimony contradict each other, we need to look for inconsistencies between the testimonies provided by Tigre and the evidence collected regarding the murder of Glen Elg. 

One potential area of contradiction arises from the evidence indicating the timeline of events surrounding the incident. 

Evidence shows that Glen Elg died of potassium cyanide poisoning and can pinpoint the time of death. We know that at least one witness, Victor Kudo, was present at Tres Bien during the time of the incident. 

On the other hand, Tigre’s testimonies state he has an alibi and claims to have been tied up with business in his office during that time. 

Looking closely at Tigre's statements:
- Testimony 0: "I don't know nothin' about no murder."
- Testimony 1: "I was tied up with business in December last year. Spent all'a my time in my office."

If Tigre was indeed in the office during the time of Glen's death (between 1:30 and 2:30 PM), there’s no way for him to know where the murder occurred and claim ignorance about it if he was tied up with business and couldn't be at the restaurant, especially since he indicates he didn't know the victim.

Thus, the contradiction arises between the evidence regarding the victim's death and Tigre's account of his whereabouts during that time.

The specific pair that highlights this contradiction is:
- **Evidence 10** (Glen's Autopsy Report - indicating time of death)
- **Testimony 1** (Tigre claiming he was tied up with business in his office).

In summary, there is a clear contradiction between Tigre's alibi and the timeline established by the autopsy report.

{"evidence": 10, "testimony": 1}

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else. Let's think step by step:
response:
To identify a contradictory pair of evidence and testimony, we need to analyze the information provided in both the evidences and testimonies related to Glen Elg and Furio Tigre.

1. **Evidence 0** mentions that the coffee cup used by the victim, Glen Elg, contained potassium cyanide, which was linked to both the victim and Maggey's fingerprints, indicating an active involvement of Maggey at the scene.

2. **Evidence 10** states that Glen Elg died from potassium cyanide poisoning, affirming that the method of murder was through coffee.

3. Conversely, **Testimony 0** from Furio Tigre directly states, "I ain't no liar. I never met Glen Elg." 

The contradiction arises here because, for the poisoning to occur at Tres Bien (where the coffee cup was used), Furio Tigre's involvement or relationship with Glen Elg is essential for establishing a motive or connection to the murder.

Thus, since Furio claims he never met Glen Elg, it contradicts the evidence indicating that Glen was murdered at the restaurant (indicating interactions with the staff, including Tigre, who was present at Tender Lender).

The conflicting pair is:
- Evidence 10: Glen's Autopsy Report shows that he died from potassium cyanide poisoning in a location that has links to Furio Tigre.
- Testimony 0 from Tigre, who states he never met Glen Elg.

Therefore, the contradicting pair is: 

{"evidence": 10, "testimony": 0}

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else. Let's think step by step:
response:
To determine which evidence and testimony contradict each other, we need to analyze the statements made in the testimonies alongside the physical evidence available.

First, we note the key details from the testimonies provided by Furio Tigre, especially testimony 0 through 4. Tigre states he was supposed to meet someone at the restaurant that afternoon and describes finding the scene of the incident. He mentions seeing the victim laid out and leaving the scene to go back to his office.

Now, let's consider the timeline. Glen Elg, the victim, was poisoned with potassium cyanide, and his time of death was reported to be between 1:30 and 2:30 PM (Evidence 10). For Tigre’s testimony to be credible, he should have been at the restaurant before the victim died. 

However, if we examine the “Millionaire Radio Flyer” (Evidence 19), it states that there is an event that takes place every Monday at 1:30 PM. Significant here is that this might suggest Tigre could have been involved in or preoccupied with this event at that precise time, which could complicate his whereabouts.

The significant contradiction can be identified as follows:
- Tigre claims he left immediately after seeing the scene, which could suggest he had no prior connection or involvement with the event occurring at 1:30 PM. 

Thus, the evidence of there being a scheduled event at exactly the time of the murder contradicts Tigre's account.

Hence, the relevant pair of evidence and testimony is:

{"evidence": 19, "testimony": 0}

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else. Let's think step by step:
response:
To analyze the evidence and testimony for contradictions, we need to identify a pair that cannot be true at the same time based on their content. 

Let's consider the testimony of Furio Tigre where he claims, "I was after the $100,000. I didn't have no other reason to kill the guy!" This suggests that Tigre's motive was solely financial and he emphasizes that he did not have other reasons for killing Glen Elg.

Now, we need to compare this with the pieces of evidence, particularly focusing on evidence related to the financial context of the case. There is Evidence 20, which is Glen's Calendar. On the day of the incident, it mentions a note saying, "Meet with The Tiger." This indicates that Tigre had a specific business arrangement with Glen, which could imply a deeper motive beyond just the immediate financial aspect.

The contradiction can be inferred from the fact that if Tigre was only after $100,000 as stated in his testimony, one would expect that there wouldn't be a planned meeting prior to the incident suggesting a continued business relationship. Tigre’s claim undermines the significance of the meeting suggested in Evidence 20.

Thus, we have a contradiction between Testimony 7 and Evidence 20.

{"evidence": 20, "testimony": 7}
